intro: Retinodendron moluccanum, commonly known as the Moluccan retinodendron, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes a wide range of plants with diverse morphological features. The plant is characterized by its striking, palmate leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
